# Vitron | SuperCharged Starter

[![docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-Vite-blue.svg?logo=Vite&logoColor=white&label=)](https://www.electronjs.org/)
[![docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-Electron-blue.svg?logo=Electron&logoColor=white&label=)](https://www.electronjs.org/) [![docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-React-blue.svg?logo=React&logoColor=white&label=)](https://reactjs.org/) [![docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-TypeScript-blue.svg?logo=TypeScript&logoColor=white&label=)](https://www.typescriptlang.org/) [![docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-MaterialUI-blue.svg?logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,&logoColor=white&label=)](mui.com) [![docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-Zustand-blue.svg?logo=data:image/png;base64,&logoColor=white&label=)](https://github.com/pmndrs/zustand)


<img width="400" src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28861537/164577641-6264ac42-c9a7-4859-a307-4bdcbf00321d.png#gh-dark-mode-only" alt="logo" style="max-width: 450px" />
<img width="400" src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28861537/164577765-eb489963-cc7c-4f82-a126-7f1582574930.png#gh-light-mode-only" alt="logo" style="max-width: 450px" />



## Overview

<details>
 <summary>click to show</summary>  

- based on [vite-react-electron](https://github.com/caoxiemeihao/vite-react-electron) <br /><span style="color:grey">(check the readme!)</span>

- inspired by [Nextron](https://github.com/saltyshiomix/nextron)

- implemented [custom-electron-titlebar](https://github.com/AlexTorresSk/custom-electron-titlebar) <br /><span style="color:grey">(activate/deactivate via package.json)</span>

- added Nextron's [IPC communication example](https://github.com/saltyshiomix/nextron/tree/main/examples/ipc-communication) <br /><span style="color:grey">(for sync and async messaging)</span>

- implemented [Material UI](https://mui.com/material-ui/react-button/) <br /><span style="color:grey">(incl. ThemeProvider & dynamic createTheme)

- implemented [Zustand](https://github.com/pmndrs/zustand/) <br /><span style="color:grey">(incl. typed store via Typescript)</span>
  
- implemented [React Router](https://reactrouter.com/)

- created example for included electron-store <br /><span style="color:grey">(incl. sync & IPC-messagning)</span>

- created proper Dark Mode, handling mui-Theme AND nativeTheme!<br /><span style="color:grey">(activate custom titlebar for awesome synergy)</span>

- added scripts to start and build the inner react project isolated

</details>




## Tutorial
  
<details>
 <summary>1. Init Project</summary>
  
```sh
  yarn create vitron
```
  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28861537/164577501-9ec62e81-a8f8-4305-97f4-d5e3639b9f2a.png)
  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28861537/164577516-5e31028e-94f4-4deb-8b9e-a3132c12e5c9.png)

</details>

<details>
 <summary>2. push it to your github</summary>
  
 *optional but highly recommended to enjoy awesome features
</details>
  
<details>
 <summary>3. Make some changes & push it</summary>
  
  
 i.e. edit `package.json` and change author
 When pushing to github, the start of your commit message is important:
 
  ## Git-Actions
  
- If your commit message starts with "Release " then win, mac & linux binaries will be created and a new release is made based on your version set inside package.json, and including all commit-messages from last release to this release are added as release-text: [like this](https://github.com/YeonV/Vitron/releases/tag/0.0.3)
  
- If your commit message startes with "web:", the inner react app is available under your [repo's github-pages](https://yeonv.github.io/Vitron/)
  
- If your commit message startes with "dev:" then this message will be excluded for the next release-text
  
</details>

<details>
 <summary>4. Enjoy auto-generated releases with precompiled binaries for mac, win & linux</summary>
  
  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28861537/164580102-43d7739e-69a7-43f5-b013-0f68aaec6c06.png)

</details>
